channel.title: Problem connecting to server
channel.description: So im trying to help a friend make a server and we've done everything right it compiles correctly the only thing is he cannot connect....he can only connect locally... i think its a problem with the portforwarding, i did the ipconfig in command promt and got 192.168.1.2 could that be the wrong address to enter when putting the ip for portforwarding? is there another way to find the right ip he needs to use?

item.title: Problem connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

well you can’t port forward that ip…you can only forward 192.168.blank.blank

Read full topic

So im trying to help a friend make a server and we’ve done everything right it compiles correctly the only thing is he cannot connect…he can only connect locally…
i think its a problem with the portforwarding, i did the ipconfig in command promt and got 192.168.1.2 could that be the wrong address to enter when putting the ip for portforwarding? is there another way to find the right ip he needs to use?
